name: Hilton Grand Vacations Club at Waikoloa Beach Resort

reviews.text: My husband and I reserved 2 two-bedroom units on the top floor with golf course views. We took along our parents and siblings for a group total of eight. The rooms are up-to-date and well decorated with a touch of asian flare. We made good use of the kitchens, cooking all but two dinners in our units. The kitchen is well stocked for basic cooking needs. We also were able to pack light and use the in-unit washer and dryer. The two bedrooms are separated by the kitchen and dining area which nicely kept noise down. The master has a king bed, double sinks, a very deep jetted tub, and a separate shower with 5 shower heads. The other bedroom has two double beds and is right next to the other bathroom which has a nice but more basic shower. The living room sofa folds out into a queen bed. My brother-in-law used it and had no complaints. The dining room table comfortably seats 6, but we always ate on the lanai which had a 4 seat table and two lounge chairs. The view of the golf course was very nice but we decided if we stay here again we will probably just get the basic unit without the upper level golf course view and save those extra points. The grounds are so beautiful with palm trees everywhere that you can't really get a bad view. The wireless internet was easy to access, it just didn't work with Firefox.
reviews.title: Great Hawaiian Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The onsite pool has a nice curvy lagoon shape with small waterfalls, a small slide, a children's area and a bar. Unlike many big resorts, you don't have to pay extra to use the poolside cabanas. A shuttle stops by every half hour which goes to the big Hilton resort, Kings' Land, the Bay Club and the Kings' Shops. So you can use any of those pools. Of course, the Hilton resort has two very big pools and the beach along their lagoon. There is also a shuttle from the Hilton resort which goes to A-Bay beach which is next door in front of the Marriott. The huge pool at Kings' Land is set to be open in October 2009.
reviews.title: Amazing!!

reviews.text: We had a wonderful week here. Our families were very impressed and had a great time. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The petroglyph walk which goes right through Waikoloa is interesting. I also recommend Hapuna Beach north of Waikoloa. It is a wide, gold sand beach without much coral or rocks so it's a great swimming/wading spot.
reviews.title: Great condo design - Beautiful location

reviews.text: If your'e planning on staying at a stunning hotel then the Hilton is the best choice! It is great, the hotel is huge, you can take a boat from one side of the hotel to the other, or go across on the monorail which is a bit slow but relaxing. There is several pools, especially a adults only pool which was brilliant, no children allowed, There is also a lagoon where you can see the fish and turtles swimming underneath you which was amazing! There was several weddings on while we was there which looked gorgeous. Everyhting about the hotel was fabololus, we had our breakfast included in the price in our stay which was a bonus, as it woukd of cost us $50 every morning, The resturants were set at a resonable price especially for the food, Only downside is, if you want lunch at the pool only a few bars do lunch, or you gotta trek to find a bar. Maids were very good our room was always clean by 11am in the morning, with clean towles, The staff was very friendly and offerd us an extra room for our last day, as we only flew at night, there was no entertainment on at night, and i would not recomend the louiw, (where the girls dance with grass skirts), it wasnt worth $90 by any means. If you are going to book this hotel then book it online not through ur travel agent as they wanted o charge is$1000 for a week, and we got it for $500 each for the week inc breakfast. Amazing hotel would definaltey recomend it to friends. There is also 2 shopping centre's at the bottom of the island which were really good they cater for all your needs, and there are some lovley resturants there to. were actually considering getting married at the hotel in the next few years!
reviews.title: JUST TOO TOO BIG

reviews.text: One week stay in August 2009 at Kohala Suites. Upgraded our ownership to 2bdrm Plus got us a 3rd floor golf course view with peekaboo ocean view in building 18. Great sunset views from here.
reviews.title: Best of Best

reviews.text: We stayed at the HGV at Waikoloa Beach in February and thought it was a great place. The condo units are not particularly lavish, but are very nice nonetheless. Nice sized decks and very nice master units and bathrooms. The pool at the HGV is heated which is somewhat of a rarity in the Waikoloa area. This was fantastic and we actually ended up using the HGV pool more than the massive pools at the Hitlton Waikoloa which as guests of the HGV we were entitled to use for free.
reviews.title: Nice Balance and Great Facility

reviews.text: This is a timeshare resort so don't expect room service or even daily maid service. This did not bother us as the convenience of the kitchen and the extra size of the condo units over a comparably priced hotel room (at the Hilton Waikoloa for example) more than offset those short comings.
reviews.title: Terrific place for kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the HGV is very good as well. Nothing much within walking distance, but tons of very fabulous beaches and other local attractions within a short drive.
reviews.title: the most beautiful and best resort ever stayed at

likes.disliked: — the lagoon water was not clean

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the HGVC in Waikoloa - we had a 2 bedroom suite for 6 of us (2 small children). It was a terrific unit - we got ground floor, which was right next to the BBQ's and looked out at the golf course. It was very spacious - even for 6 people. The only negative is the kitchen is a bit awkwardly designed - especially is 2 people are working in it. But overall - the place was fabulous.
reviews.title: Hawaii (big Island) is breathtaking!

likes.disliked: — nothing it met all our needs

reviews.text: The best part is the fact that you can use all the facilities at the Hilton Waikoloa resort. We spent the week camped out at the Lagoon - which was perfect for the 4 and 6 year old. We bought the family package for the week - which gave us access to kayaks, paddle boats, snorkel and fins, kiddie boats, etc. It was about $250 and it kept the kids entertained all week. The Lagoon is also warmer than most of the pools at the resort! The snorkelling is wonderful - there are numerous sea turtles, eels, and pretty fish to look at. Also the dolphins are spectacular. If you can afford it - do the swim with the dolphins. Also a hit were the water slides - there are 2 and they are really fun for all ages. And an insider tip - at one of the pools there is a little food market and they have ice cream for $1 a scoop from 3 - 4 pm every day (generous scoops!).
reviews.title: HGVC Waikoloa is fantastic!

likes.disliked: — Lanai could have been a little larger, but was adequate

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club condos and weren’t actually staying in the Hilton Waikoloa Village Beach Resort but were allowed to use all of the facilities and pools over there. I guess that staying at the condos are better than staying in the hotel because you get two bedrooms, two bathrooms, a full kitchen & dining room, a living room, a balcony/back yard, a place to grill, and are next to the clubhouse. As for getting over to the resort there is a free shuttle bus that takes you to various places within the gigantic resort area or you can always walk or drive.
reviews.title: Lots of space, activities, & beautiful things to see.

reviews.text: The club condos are very spacious and quiet. It would be nice to have a view of the ocean in the back but all you get is a golf course. The nearest beach is ‘Anaeho’omalu or "A Bay" which you can drive to or take a shuttle to. The beach was beautiful but the water was chilly and very murky. We ended up taking the shuttle a few times over to the Hilton Waikoloa Village Beach Resort to walk around, eat, snorkel in the lagoon, and swim in the pools. The lagoon really isn't much for snorkeling. It can be dark and murky in places but does have some fish and sea turtles in it. One of the sea turtles even swam after me trying to eat my yellow bikini (they eat yellow leaves in the lagoon and thought I was also food). The pools are huge but very shallow and ice cold so they weren't very comfortable to swim in. The clubhouse over by the HGVC condos also had a very small shallow pool that was warmer and hot tub.
reviews.title: Hilton GVC at Waikoloa - Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Out on the far edge of the condos and golf course is the King's Trail that goes straight through the lava fields and has many ancient petroglyphs to see.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, wonderful restaurants.

reviews.text: As far as beaches go we also went to Hapuna beach about 10 minutes up the road which was one of my favorites. It's not a really good "calm swimming" beach but is beautiful and excellent for boogie boarding and the sand is super fine.
reviews.title: Loved the room, hate the location.

reviews.text: The resort itself is very green and lush but the surrounding area is a lava desert which really doesn't matter because it's within short driving distance of beautiful beaches and Waikoloa Village for groceries. It's also a good location for the weather since it's located in the driest part of the island. I would also recommend the ABC shop in the marketplace for necessities and souvenirs.
reviews.title: 2nd Stay at HGVC Waikoloa

reviews.text: We just returned from a 10 day stay at the HGVC Waikoloa with our 9 year old twins. On the plus side, the condos are very well appointed, spacious and it was great to have the kitchen and washer/dryer. Guests staying here have access to all the amenities at the Hilton and our kids ABSOLUTELY LOVED the slides at the Hilton. This kept them very entertained. We also enjoyed seeing the dolphins and snorkeling with the turtles in the man made lagoon. The hotel was at fairly low occupancy so we never had trouble finding chairs.
reviews.title: Nice Rooms but No Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Negatives would be that there is no beach access at the condos or the hotel. The slides were great, but we could have been at a waterpark anywhere to get those features. The real reason to go to Hawaii is for the amazing beaches and it was a bummer on vacation to have to schlep all of our stuff in a car to the beach. We would have much preferred the option of walking to the beach from the hotel and being able to purchase snacks, drinks etc while there.
reviews.title: WOW- beautiful place and pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another negative is that there is no place on the property to purchase food. After a long day out it would have been nice to just walk to dinner. (The King's Grille near the resort is great for breakfast and lunch, good prices and good food but not open for dinner) The food at the Hilton hotel was generally poor and fairly limited. (One of the restaurants was closed and pool service was spotty) We did purchase groceries at the Queens Market, but it is not wihin walking distance.
reviews.title: Great Family Resort even for a Couple

reviews.text: Parking at the Hilton was a little crazy and they didn't have any organized children's nor adult tennis activiites (maybe b/c of low occupancy) which we were disappointed by
reviews.title: Great resort

reviews.text: We would choose to stay at an oceanfront property next time and buy a day pass for the pools at the Hilton. I probably wouldn't recommend paying full price to stay here, but if you can get a good deal like we did, it is worth it.
reviews.title: Fantastic Resort Property

likes.liked: — The Beauty and sheer Size of the Property
likes.disliked: — Lenght of travel from our room to the main lobby

aka: Hilton Grand Vacations Club At Waikoloa Beach Hotel
description: Superbly situated adjacent to championship golf courses, the premier location of the Hilton Grand Vacation Club resort provides an unsurpassed vacation setting. Hotel guests have access and charging privileges to the abundant facilities and amenities of the nearby Hilton Waikoloa Village hotel, including an enticing array of restaurants, boutiques, beaches and water recreation. Complimentary shuttle service is available between the Hilton Grand Vacations Club at Waikoloa Beach Resort, the Hilton Waikoloa Village, and area shops. Hawaii visitors staying at Hilton Grand Vacations Club at Waikoloa Beach Resort will enjoy spacious two-bedroom suites which incorporate a casually elegant tropical style, and feature a superb variety of upscale amenities and furnishings.
